meanings.definition: A disk or cylinder with an irregular form such that its motion, usually rotary, gives a specific kind of reciprocating motion to a part in contact with it.
meanings.sent1: The cams on the machine help create a back-and-forth movement in the tool.
meanings.sent2: The engine's cams control the up and down motion of the valves.
meanings.sent3: The cams decided to dance in a zigzag pattern, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes followed the cams of the clock, ticking away the seconds like a metronome.
meanings.sent5: The cams on the wheel made it spin in a unique, bumpy rhythm.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic inspected the cams to ensure they were functioning smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The cams in the car's engine control the timing of the valves.
meanings.sent3: The cams at the party were the life of the event, always in the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as cams, turning the gears of change in the organization.
meanings.sent5: The cams in the factory worked tirelessly, orchestrating the movements of the machinery.
